intro: Aglaia polyneura, commonly known as the white aglaia, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Meliaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces yellow or orange fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy, aromatic pulp. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. Aglaia polyneura thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
